0.description: You can use one or two gradients per color. If you use one, you have to manuall remap all colors for e.g. dark mode that you want to be changed. If you use two gradients, you can automatially reference the dark gradient (mirrored light gradient) and then you have to manually remap all colors that you want to stay the same.

REM.description: REM is the base-size of all font-sizes. The default is 16(px), so it relates to 1rem = 16(px). If you change it, it will change all font-related tokens.

base.description:
Depending on what unit you want to add to your font-sizes, you have to change your calculation here:
If you are adding px (or nothing which defaults to px) in your font-size tokens, use this calculation here: {core.font-size.REM} / 100
If you are adding rem, use: 1/100

scale.description:
Since ever, type scales are used to define a set of useful text sizes. The problem is: You won't end up with whole numbers, instead with crooked decimal numbers. Some of us designers like to stick to those type scales, others like to build their own with nice whole numbers ...

Popuplar ratios are: 1.067 Minor Second, 1.125 Major Second, 1.200 Minor Third, 1.250 Major Third, 1.333 Perfect Fourth, 1.414 Augmented Fourth, 1.500 Perfect Fifth, 1.618 Golden Ratio

xs.description: This is probably your headlines line-height.

s.description: This is probably your interface line-height or also gladly used for headlines.

m.description: This is probably your non-article line-height.

l.description: This is probably your article line-height.

SCALE.description: Hi there! SCALE is the base-scale of all size-related tokens (size, space, dimension). The default is 16(px), so it relates to 1rem = 16(px) for font-sizes. If you change it, it will change all size-related tokens. :)

0.description: Box shadow tokens don't yet support referencing each other, that's why they are a little rigid still. The feature will come soon, though.

intensity.description: Drop shadows are more visible on light backgrounds than dark ones. In order to be able to intensify the drop shadows on dark theme, you can use a variable/token like this and bump it up in your dark theme.

angle.description: It's base.color.gradients.angle so it shows up in the object of all gradients in the json-file.

1.description: This scope/scale is by the power of 2. This is the easiest version of spacing tokens, not really semantic and probably not detailed enough for real pixel-perfect designs, but enough to make a functioning interface.

default.description: Only two colors needed when color modifiers are used on component level.

bg.description: Only 6 tokens needed with the use of some color modifiers on component level.
The old-school way without color modifiers on component level.

darker.description: Your primary and secondary brand colors are not necessarily your primary and secondary interaction colors, that's why I added those tokens.

none.description: This is basically your page margin (in breakpoints-speak).
This is basically your page gutter (in breakpoints-speak).

m.description: m is the size of body text which is typically the same size as h6.

ml.description: ml is large body text which is typically the same size as h5.

xxxl.description: xxxl is your h1, but don't tell anyone, we want to speak in tokens not in HTML markup.

scale.description: I added a scale here to be able to change the roundness of all border-radiuses simultaneously. That can be a very nice mechanism for several other tokens.

enabled-bg.description: This set and error and success above are unstable sets and only meant to be used in "Apply to selection" mode. Select either error OR success and then this set (special buttons) and render the button with "Apply to selection". It minimizes redundance, but is not stable between themes.
Those are stable sets that change correctly when the theme is changed. Primary is completely realized with color-modifers, secondary with some color-modifiers and tertiary the old-school way without.
